user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of calc_userhash:
```c
_MHD_static_inline void
calc_userhash (struct DigestAlgorithm *da,
               const char *username, const size_t username_len,
               const char *realm, const size_t realm_len,
               uint8_t *digest_bin)
{
  mhd_assert (NULL != username);
  mhd_assert (! da->hashing);
  digest_update (da, username, username_len);
  digest_update_with_colon (da);
  digest_update (da, realm, realm_len);
  digest_calc_hash (da, digest_bin);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
mhd_assert (NULL != username);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the fragment calls mhd_assert(NULL != username), which is an assertion/check and does not itself call calc_userhash. There is no evidence here of direct or indirect recursion. (Only if mhd_assert were implemented to call, directly or via its handlers, calc_userhash would Rule 17.2 be violated.)
